author: Robert Lee Hotz
title: Neanderthals Had a Creative Side, New Cave Art Studies Suggest
text:
Neanderthals, once considered the low-brows of human evolution, may have been among the worldâ€™s first artists, creating cave paintings long before modern humanity arrived on the scene, scientists reported in two new studies Thursday.
Although these primitive cousins of humankind mastered fire and made tools, most archaeologists have assumed until now that they lacked the cognitive capacity for artistic expression, unlike early humans who painted vivid images of lions, rhinos and other animals on cave walls.
